title: Aborn Opera Company
text:
The Aborn Opera company was an American <a href="opera">opera</a> company that was active from 1895 through 1922.
History.
Founded and operated by brothers <a href="Milton%20Aborn">Milton Aborn</a> (1864–1933) and <a href="Sargent%20Aborn">Sargent Aborn</a> (1866–1956), the company was based out of <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a> but spent most of its time on the road touring the United States. Milton was born in <a href="Marysville%2C%20California">Marysville, California</a> in 1864, and his brother Sargent was born in <a href="Boston%2C%20Massachusetts">Boston, Massachusetts</a> in 1866. They had been theater managers since 1885. From 1913 to 1915 they were managers at the <a href="Century%20Theatre%20%28New%20York%20City%29">Century Theatre</a> in <a href="Manhattan">Manhattan</a>.
From 1912 until 1915 <a href="Ralph%20Lyford">Ralph Lyford</a> conducted over 200 performances of operas with the company.
